abstract.para:
See "01_ASDN_readme.txt" (under "Download Data" tab) for data author and contact information. Field data on shorebird ecology and environmental conditions were collected from 1993-2014 at 16 field sites in Alaska, Canada, and Russia. Data were not collected in every year at all sites. Studies of the population ecology of these birds included nest-monitoring to determine timing of reproduction and reproductive success; live capture of birds to collect blood samples, feathers, and fecal samples for investigations of population structure and pathogens; banding of birds to determine annual survival rates; resighting of color-banded birds to determine space use and site fidelity; and use of light-sensitive geolocators to investigate migratory movements. Data on climatic conditions, prey abundance, and predators were also collected. Environmental data included weather stations that recorded daily climatic conditions, surveys of seasonal snowmelt, weekly sampling of terrestrial and aquatic invertebrates that are prey of shorebirds, live trapping of small mammals (alternate prey for shorebird predators), and daily counts of potential predators (jaegers, falcons, foxes). Detailed field methods for each year are available in the ASDN_protocol_201X.pdf files. All research was conducted under permits from relevant federal, state and university authorities.
Potential users of these data should first contact the relevant data author(s), listed below. This will enable coordination in terms of updates/corrections to the data and ongoing analyses. Key analyses of the data are in progress and will be included in the theses and dissertations of graduate students who collected these field data.
Please acknowledge this dataset and the authors in any analysis, publication, presentation, or other output that uses these data. If you use the full dataset, we suggest you cite it as: Lanctot, RB, SC Brown, and BK Sandercock. 2017. Arctic Shorebird Demographics Network. NSF Arctic Data Center. doi: INSERT HERE. If you use data from only one or a few sites, we suggest you cite data for each site as per this example: Lanctot, RB and ST Saalfeld. 2017. Barrow, 2014. Arctic Shorebird Demographics Network. NSF Arctic Data Center. doi: INSERT HERE. Note that each updated version of the dataset has its own unique DOI.
Disclaimers: The dataset is distributed “as is” and with absolutely no warranty. The data providers have invested considerable effort to ensure that the data are of highest quality, but it is possible that undetected errors remain. Data have been processed with several steps for quality assurance, but the data providers accept no liability or guarantee that the data are up-to-date, correct, or complete. Access to data is provided on the understanding that the data providers are not responsible for any damages from inaccuracies in the data.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: CONTINENT > EUROPE > EASTERN EUROPE > RUSSIA, CANADA > MANITOBA, CANADA > ONTARIO, CANADA > NUNAVUT, CANADA > HUDSON BAY, GEOGRAPHIC REGION > ARCTIC, UNITED STATES OF AMERICA > ALASKA, CANADA > NORTHWEST TERRITORIES,

dataTable.entityDescription: This file provides data collected when a bird was captured, typically for banding or sampling. There is one record per capture, so birds captured more than once have multiple records.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Corresponding book and page number for this record in the field notebook/datasheets

textDomain.definition: Format: book.pagenumber (e.g. X.XX)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Year in which data were collected
Four-letter code of site at which data were collected (nome)

codeDefinition.definition: Canning River Delta, Alaska, USA (lat 70.1, long -145.8)
Chaun River Delta, Chukotka, Russia (lat 68.8, long 170.6)
Colville River Delta, Alaska, USA (lat 70.4, long -150.7)
Lower Khatanga River, Krasnoyarsk, Russia (lat 72.9, long 106.1)
Mackenzie River Delta, Northwest Territories, Canada (lat 69.4, long -135.0)

attribute.attributeDefinition: person who handled and banded the bird

textDomain.definition: First letter and last name (usually) or initials
Format: dd-month-yy
Julian date of capture
Format: 00:00
If the bird was captured on a nest, a unique ID was given to the nest (see Bird_Nests for more information)
Identifier of the study plot on which a bird was captured. Some names may be duplicated across sites, but are unique within sites. See Geodata for plot locations.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Bird capture location relative to plot boundaries

textDomain.definition: Indicates whether the nest was within ("in") or outside of ("out") the boundaries of a nest-monitoring study plot. If not given, assume the nest was located on-plot. This value was determined in the field; see Plot_limit_corr for corrected value determined later with GIS.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Latitude of capture location in decimal degrees
Longitude of capture location in decimal degrees

textDomain.definition: Unique number of the original metal band applied to the bird. If no metal band was applied but bird is uniquely identifiable by color bands, bird is assigned an arbitrary 3-digit number. "noband" = bird captured but no bands applied.
Unique number of the metal band currently on the bird upon its release. This may differ from Original_band if the metal band was changed. If blank, same as Original_band.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Four-letter code for the species captured
Sex of the bird, if determined at time of capture.
Age of bird as recorded in the field.

textDomain.definition: Age of bird as recorded in the field.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Method used to determine bird's age in the field

codeDefinition.definition: after hatch year. Adult of unknown age, not identified as sy or asy
adult that is more than three years old (after third-year)
chick that was raised in captivity and subsequently released into the wild
adult that definitely did not hatch in previous year
hatch year. Chick hatched at current year, unknown location, that can fly at capture
adult that hatched in the previous year

attribute.attributeDefinition: Status of bird upon completion of handling

Color band(s) applied to upper left leg (above the tarsal joint); Color band(s) applied to lower left leg below the tarsal joint); Color band(s) applied to upper right leg (above the tarsal joint); Color band(s) applied to lower right leg below the tarsal joint)

codeDefinition.definition: dark green flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code
white flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code

attribute.attributeDefinition: Engraved flag code applied to bird

textDomain.definition: Three-digit alphanumeric code engraved on the colored leg flag applied to the bird. Letters are recorded here in lowercase for clarity (e.g. "0" vs. "o"), but engraved in uppercase. If none given, engraved flag was not applied or code was not recorded.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Type of flag applied to bird

textDomain.definition: Flag is either engraved, plain, or not applied.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether the bird was captured in a previous year (should be double-checked against other data)
Whether the bird was previously captured in the same year (should be double-checked against other data)
Whether the bird's metal or color bands were changed during this handling event. Not relevant unless bird is a recapture

textDomain.definition: If any bands were changed, this provides the bird's previous metal band number (carried by the bird upon capture and replaced by "Band," above, if different).

attribute.attributeDefinition: If any bands were changed, this provides the bird's previous color combination on the upper left leg, lower left leg, upper right leg, and lower right leg (carried by the bird upon capture and replaced by "Upper_left", "Lower_left", "Upper_right", and "Lower_right" above, if different).

codeDefinition.definition: dark green flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code
white flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code

textDomain.definition: If any bands were changed, this provides the bird's previous engraved flag code (carried by the bird upon capture and replaced by "Engraved_flag" above, if different).
Whether a radio or satellite tag was applied to the bird (blank = no tag).

Whether a light-level geolocator tag was applied to the bird (either the identifier of the tag, or "yes" if a tag was applied but number was not recorded; blank = no tag applied). Geolocators were applied with a leg band or flag attachment.
Time at which the geolocator was applied or (for recaptured birds) removed.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Method by which bird was captured

textDomain.definition: method of capture (some described in the ASDN protocal PDF)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Stage of breeding cycle at which bird was captured

textDomain.definition: pre-lay: pre-egg-laying period; laying: egg-laying period as determined by stage of nest or signs that bird is about to or has just laid an egg; inc: incubating eggs; brood: adult attending chicks (at or away from nest); postbreed: bird captured away from a nest during end of summer or fall; unknown: unknown breeding cycle

Whether one or more photos were taken of the bird in the hand; n=no, y=yes. Sometimes indicates what photos were taken versus not: wing (spread wing feathers), combo (band combination on legs), data (datasheet with corresponding info)

codeDefinition.definition: old feather missing/new pin feather present
new feather greater than 2/3 grown with sheath
old feather missing/new pin feather present
new feather greater than 2/3 grown with sheath
old feather missing/new pin feather present
new feather greater than 2/3 grown with sheath

attribute.attributeDefinition: Body molt of head, neck, back, breast, and abdomen
Measured with calipers from tip of culment to notch at back of head, measured to nearest 0.1 mm. See ASDN_Protocol.pdf for further details.
Diagonal tarsus, measured with calipers from indentation below the tarsal joint to the indentation above the longest toe, measured to nearest 0.1 mm. See ASDN_Protocol.pdf for further details.
Maximum flattened and straightened length of folded wing, measured with wing ruler to nearest mm. See ASDN_Protocol.pdf for further details.
Weight of bird plus measuring cone or bag, to nearest 0.1 g, measured with hanging Pesola scale
Weight of cone or bag in which bird was weighed
Net weight of bird (Weight - Bag_wt) to nearest 0.1 g

codeDefinition.definition: bottom of furculum covered, less than 1/3 full
furculum 2/3 to level w/clavicles, wing, abdomen

attribute.attributeDefinition: Estimated blood volume collected based on number and percent of capillary tubes filled. y = blood taken but not recorded; trace = unmeasurably small amount taken.

codeDefinition.definition: about 100 µl of blood taken for avian malaria testing
no blood samples taken for testing

attribute.attributeDefinition: Type of capillary tube used to collect sample for malaria test.

textDomain.definition: EDTA (anti-coagulant), heparin (heparinized anti-coagulant), or unknown. Numbers are occasionally provided but these are probably a data entry error.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Type of blood preservative used for malaria sample.

textDomain.definition: RNAlater, Lysis (Queen's Lysis Buffer), or unknown.

codeDefinition.definition: about 25 to 50 ul of blood collected for genetic sample
no blood samples taken for testing

attribute.attributeDefinition: Amount of blood taken for genetic sample
Type of preservative for genetic blood sample

textDomain.definition: longmire, Lysis, or unknown

attribute.attributeDefinition: Type of capillary tube used to collect sample for genetic blood sample.

textDomain.definition: EDTA, heparin, plain (no anti-coagulant), hematocrit (no preservative, stored in capillary tube with ends capped), or unknown

attribute.attributeDefinition: Blood collected for methyl mercury testing

codeDefinition.definition: about 60 µl blood collected in heparin capillary tube for methyl mercury testing
no blood samples taken for testing

attribute.attributeDefinition: Amount of blood (µl) taken for methyl mercury testing
Type of capillary tube used to collect sample for methyl mercury testing

textDomain.definition: heparin, plain, or hematocrit

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether feathers were collected for the ASDN archive
Which feathers were collected for ASDN archive

codeDefinition.definition: 1st primary on left and right wing
8th secondary on left and right wing
1st rectrix on right side of tail
6 primary covert on left and right wing
1st primary on left and right wing and breast feathers
feathers collected but no info on which feathers

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether 3-5 breast feathers were collected for moss dispersal side-project
Whether fecal sample was collected (passive sampling by placing bird in box for few minutes) for gut microbiota side-project.
What type of preservative was used for fecal sample

textDomain.definition: 100ethanol, 70isopropanol, 91isopropanol (numbers indicate proofs).

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether cloaca was swabbed for avian influenza testing
Avian influenza sample number if applicable

textDomain.definition: Avian influenza sample number if applicable

attribute.attributeDefinition: Type of sample taken for avian influenca, if applicable.
Whether a blood plasma sample was taken for malaria testing.
Whether a red blood cell sample was taken for malaria testing.
Type of preservative for malaria red blood cell sample

textDomain.definition: longmire

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether a blood sample was taken for RNALater analysis
Type of capillary tube used to collect RNALater blood sample

textDomain.definition: heparin, plain (no anti-coagulant), blank = no sample collected
Preservative used for other types of blood samples

attribute.attributeDefinition: Type of capillary tube used to store blood sample

textDomain.definition: EDTA, plain, blank = no sample collected

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether a blood sample was taken for methyl mercury testing.

textDomain.definition: Label/identifier of egg or chick from a particular nest (1 through 4).

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether a tissue sample was taken from a chick.

codeDefinition.definition: yes; some samples have identifiers/label numbers

attribute.attributeDefinition: Type of tissue sample taken from chick, if applicable.

textDomain.definition: Type of tissue sample taken from chick, if applicable. "Specimen" indicates whole chick was preserved
Any further field or data-management notes relevant to this record. "ELW note" indicates data-management comment added by Emily Weiser.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Corrected plot limit values calculated in GIS

textDomain.definition: Corrected "Plot_limit"" GIS calculations: indicates whether the bird was captured within (in) or outside (out) of the boundaries of a nest monitoring study plot. If not given, assume the bird was captured on-plot.

dataTable.entityDescription: Measurements (length and width) of shorebird eggs.

textDomain.definition: Data book and page number in which the data were recorded; not used by all sites

attribute.attributeDefinition: Year in which data were collected
Four-letter code of site at which data were collected (nome)

codeDefinition.definition: Canning River Delta, Alaska, USA (lat 70.1, long -145.8)
Chaun River Delta, Chukotka, Russia (lat 68.8, long 170.6)
Colville River Delta, Alaska, USA (lat 70.4, long -150.7)
Lower Khatanga River, Krasnoyarsk, Russia (lat 72.9, long 106.1)
Mackenzie River Delta, Northwest Territories, Canada (lat 69.4, long -135.0)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier (YY Site Species) of the nest from which the egg was measured

textDomain.definition: Identifier format: YY-Site Code-Species Code-Numeric OR other unique identifier
Egg number within the nest (usually an arbitrary designation)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Length of egg at the longest point
Width of egg at the longest point

textDomain.definition: Additional information on data

dataTable.entityDescription: Data for each nest that was discovered as part of the ASDN monitoring protocols. Some nests were not monitored after discovery. One record per nest.

textDomain.definition: Data book and page number in which the data were recorded; not used by all sites

attribute.attributeDefinition: Year in which data were collected
Four-letter code of site at which data were collected (nome)

codeDefinition.definition: Canning River Delta, Alaska, USA (lat 70.1, long -145.8)
Chaun River Delta, Chukotka, Russia (lat 68.8, long 170.6)
Colville River Delta, Alaska, USA (lat 70.4, long -150.7)
Lower Khatanga River, Krasnoyarsk, Russia (lat 72.9, long 106.1)
Mackenzie River Delta, Northwest Territories, Canada (lat 69.4, long -135.0)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier (YY Site Species) of the nest from which the egg was measured

textDomain.definition: Identifier format: YY-Site Code-Species Code-Numeric OR other unique identifier

attribute.attributeDefinition: Four-letter code for the species captured

textDomain.definition: First initial and last name (or initials) of person who found the nest.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Julian date when nest was found
Latitude of nest location in decimal degrees
Longitude of nest location in decimal degrees

textDomain.definition: Identifier of the study plot on which the nest was located. Some names may be duplicated across sites, but are unique within sites. See Geodata for plot locations.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Bird capture location relative to plot boundaries

textDomain.definition: Indicates whether the nest was within ("in") or outside of ("out") the boundaries of a nest-monitoring study plot. If not given, assume the nest was located on-plot. This value was determined in the field; see Plot_limit_corr for corrected value determined later with GIS.
Plot stake marking the quadrant of the plot in which nest was located; used only at Barrow for internal reference.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Best estimate of hatch date, as per egg floating (see below), observations of timing of egg laying, or observed hatching eggs or hatchling chicks.
Best estimate of hatch date in julian days
Method by which the nest was discovered

codeDefinition.definition: found incidentally during some other activity when nest-searching was not a priority
found during systematic survey (e.g. walking zig-zags down the plot)

textDomain.definition: Original band numer (see Bird_Captures metadata) for one of the adults attending the nest
Original band number (see Bird_Captures metadata) for the second adult attending the nest

attribute.attributeDefinition: Color combination on upper left, lower left, upper right, and lower right leg for the first adult attending the nest

codeDefinition.definition: dark green flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code
white flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code

attribute.attributeDefinition: Engraved flag code for the first adult

textDomain.definition: Engraved flag code (see Bird_Captures metadata) for the first adult attending the nest

attribute.attributeDefinition: Color combination on upper left, lower left, upper right, and lower right leg for the first adult attending the nest

codeDefinition.definition: dark green flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code
white flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code

attribute.attributeDefinition: Engraved flag code for the first adult

textDomain.definition: Engraved flag code (see Bird_Captures metadata) for the first adult attending the nest
Number of banded adults seen attending the nest
Current band number for the first adult attending the nest
Current band number for the second adult attending the nest
Maximum number of eggs recorded for this nest
Number of eggs in the nest upon discovery. Sometimes indicates the number of chicks (if applicable) instead of eggs, as noted.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date on which eggs were floated to age the nest

textDomain.definition: Estimated age at which the nest was floated, usually in days (numeric value) but sometimes relative (e.g. "at hatch")

attribute.attributeDefinition: Last date on which the nest was known to be active
Last julian date on which the nest was known to be active
Date that nest fate was recorded
Estimated date on which the nest was initiated (first egg was laid)
Estimated julian date on which the nest was initiated (first egg was laid)
Estimated date on which incubation commenced
Estimated date on which the nest hatched
Estimated julian date on which the nest hatched

codeDefinition.definition: age determined by floating eggs. Used if number of eggs = 4 at nest discovery; or if number of eggs less than 4 and no further eggs were laid after discovery.
nests found during laying (number of eggs increases after nest discovery)
or nests found at hatching stage (chicks in nest or very close to nest; for nests that had pipped eggs one day and chicks gone the next, use the day after eggs found pipped)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Breeding stage at which nest was found

codeDefinition.definition: chicks found with parents away from nest
nest and eggs failed, depredated, or destroyed
unable to determine fate of monitored nest, eggs disappeared and unknown if hatched or depredated
nest not monitoried to determine fate

attribute.attributeDefinition: cause of failure or undetermined status, if applicable

codeDefinition.definition: eggs are present in a nest longer than the expected hatch/fledge date (greater than 7d) and/or no attendant adults are present on repeated visits (eggs are typically cold or wet); not used if other eggs known to have hatched or been depredated
nest failed (eggs killed or abandoned) as result of severe weather event
nest failed (eggs killed or abandoned) as result of severe weather event
nest attended well past estimated hatch date but never hatched
nest crushed by ungulate or non-research-related human activity or vehicles
nest failed due to researcher activity, e.g. direct cue to predator of nest location or inadvertent damage by observer
one or both parents known to have died
other cause of failure, sometimes defined in comments

attribute.attributeDefinition: number of parents from which blood was sampled
Number of eggs accidentally destroyed by researchers
Number of undamaged eggs collected for research purposes. Note some observers recorded abandoned eggs as "collected" so these numbers do not add up to clutch size
Number of eggs depredated or disappeared from nest (does not included eggs collected or accidentally destroyed by researchers)
Number of eggs depredated or disappeared from nest (does not included eggs collected or accidentally destroyed by researchers)
Number of eggs depredated; note this is sometimes included in NumEggLost
Number of eggs left unattended in nest cup, sometimes after other egg(s) hatched
Number of eggs that were attended but did not hatch past the expected hatch date. Only used by some sites.
Number of eggs with unknown fate. Only used by some sites.
Number of eggs known to have hatched. Only used by some sites.
Number of chicks observed as having hatched from this nest. Only used by some sites.

textDomain.definition: Dominant landform in which nest was located. See Appendix G of ASDN Field Protocol for definitions.
Dominant vegetation around the nest site. See Appendix G of ASDN Field Protocol for definitions.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Percent of the nest concealed by vegetation, as observed from above, as of mid incubation
Experimental treatment applied to this nest, if any. Treatment may have affected nest fate so these nests should be excluded from most analyses. Trapping/banding of adult birds not recorded here.

codeDefinition.definition: egg(s) added as part of incubation study
clutch removed as part of renesting study (early or late in incubation period)
some or all eggs were collected for research, sometimes replaced with dummy eggs
some or all eggs replaced with other eggs (sometimes from different species) for research purposes
invasive sample (e.g. brain tissue) taken from embryos; could cause mortality or abandonment
at least one parent was carrying geolocator; could damage eggs
egg broken by researcher was removed from the nest

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date that the treatment was applied to the nest, if known.

textDomain.definition: Additional notes

attribute.attributeDefinition: Corrected plot limit values calculated in GIS

textDomain.definition: Corrected "Plot_limit"" GIS calculations: indicates whether the bird was captured within (in) or outside (out) of the boundaries of a nest monitoring study plot. If not given, assume the bird was captured on-plot.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether or not one or both parents attending this nest had been observed attending a previous nest earlier in the season. Renesting occurred following failure of the previous nest. We recommend checking the values of this column against the data - values assigned in the field may not be accurate.

dataTable.entityDescription: Record of encounters of banded birds. This includes all records in the Bird_Captures file and also all information on adults attending nests from Bird_Nests. This is thus a complete record of the encounter history of every individual banded at Nome (but some details on capture and sampling are found in the Bird_captures file).

attribute.attributeDefinition: Year in which data were collected
Four-letter code of site at which data were collected (nome)

codeDefinition.definition: Canning River Delta, Alaska, USA (lat 70.1, long -145.8)
Chaun River Delta, Chukotka, Russia (lat 68.8, long 170.6)
Colville River Delta, Alaska, USA (lat 70.4, long -150.7)
Lower Khatanga River, Krasnoyarsk, Russia (lat 72.9, long 106.1)
Mackenzie River Delta, Northwest Territories, Canada (lat 69.4, long -135.0)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Four-letter code for the species captured

textDomain.definition: If the bird was captured on a nest, a unique ID was given to the nest (see Bird_Nests for more information)
Identifier of the study plot on which a bird was captured. Some names may be duplicated across sites, but are unique within sites. See Geodata for plot locations.
Plot stake marking the quadrant of the plot in which nest was located; used only at Barrow for internal reference.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Latitude of capture location in decimal degrees
Longitude of capture location in decimal degrees

textDomain.definition: Unique number of the original metal band applied to the bird. If no metal band was applied but bird is uniquely identifiable by color bands, bird is assigned an arbitrary 3-digit number. "noband" = bird captured but no bands applied.
Unique number of the metal band currently on the bird upon its release. This may differ from Original_band if the metal band was changed. If blank, same as Original_band.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Color band(s) applied to upper left leg (above the tarsal joint); Color band(s) applied to lower left leg below the tarsal joint); Color band(s) applied to upper right leg (above the tarsal joint); Color band(s) applied to lower right leg below the tarsal joint)

codeDefinition.definition: dark green flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code
white flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code

attribute.attributeDefinition: Engraved flag code applied to bird

textDomain.definition: Three-digit alphanumeric code engraved on the colored leg flag applied to the bird. Letters are recorded here in lowercase for clarity (e.g. "0" vs. "o"), but engraved in uppercase. If none given, engraved flag was not applied or code was not recorded.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Upper left, lower left, upper right, and lower right leg band corrected after referencing capture database.

codeDefinition.definition: dark green flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code
white flag engraved with 3-digit alphanumeric code

textDomain.definition: Engraved_flag corrected after referencing capture database.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The color-band combination of the bird's mate

textDomain.definition: Apparent mate of this bird, usually referenced by color-band combination, as determined by field observations
First initial and last name (or initials) of person who found the nest.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Observer's own rating of the accuracy of their resighting observation (notes or intermediate values are sometimes provided)

codeDefinition.definition: locations of several color bands observed, although not all bands seen; exact location of some bands unknown; recorded in notes of all known/unknown parts of leg.

most or all bands observed and recorded; if all bands recorded, exact location/order not certain, or colors not certain (i.e. red (r) or orange (o); read part of alpha-numeric flag code (if present); recorded in notes of all known/unknown parts of leg.

all bands observed and recorded. Confident that location and colors of bands are correct or confident in engraved flag code (if present). Observed bird and checked notebook several times to make sure written down correctly.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Assessment of accuracty of observation, as conducted during the verification and proofing of the resighting data

codeDefinition.definition: all colorbands or engraved flag recorded, verified in database
most (greater than 75%) colorbands or engraved flag recorded, verified in database
some colorbands (less than 50%) or engraved flag recorded, partially verified in database
metal band number read off captured or recaptured individual, verified in database
bird was recorded as one adult attending a monitored nest; further details unavailable

textDomain.definition: Additional comments

attribute.attributeDefinition: Corrected plot limit values calculated in GIS

textDomain.definition: Corrected "Plot_limit"" GIS calculations: indicates whether the bird was captured within (in) or outside (out) of the boundaries of a nest monitoring study plot. If not given, assume the bird was captured on-plot.

dataTable.entityDescription: Compiles information across all capture, resighting, and nesting records to determine the sex of each bird. If records conflict with no majority consensus, sex is marked "unknown (u)" and the Sex_method column shows "conflicting_records". Otherwise sex is assigned as male "m" or female "f". "Year" is the first year that a bird was captured. See Bird_captures for definitions of other column headers.

textDomain.definition: Unique number of the original metal band applied to the bird. If no metal band was applied but bird is uniquely identifiable by color bands, bird is assigned an arbitrary 3-digit number. "noband" = bird captured but no bands applied.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Year in which data were collected
Sex of the bird, if determined at time of capture.

codeDefinition.definition: sex determined by color or shape of plumage
sex determined by culmen length (for species in which one sex reliably has a shorter or longer culmen)
presence or absence of brood patch, for species in which only one sex incubates
sex determined by comparing morphology between members of a breeding pair
sex detemined in previous year using various methods
distended cloaca from recent egg laying indicated female
bird laid an egg during handling
discriminant function analysis models, e.g. for Dunlin
assignment of sex is based on mates's DFA score (For example, if DFA score of mate is a female, we assume its mate is a male)

dataTable.entityDescription: Pertinent information about field work in each year for the period 2010-2014. One row per year.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Four-letter code of site at which data were collected.

textDomain.definition: See attribute "Site_name" for "ASDN_Bird_captures.csv" Data Table for site code definitions

attribute.attributeDefinition: Year in which data were collected

textDomain.definition: Full name of the site; corresponds approximately with that given in Site_info metadata.

attribute.attributeDefinition: First year this site participated in the ASDN

End date of field season, when camp was established and monitoring activities ceased

End date of nest survival (i.e., date when last nest was checked)

End date when terrestrial food resources traps were removed

dataTable.entityDescription: Record of the species (birds and mammals) encountered during field work each day at each site

attribute.attributeDefinition: Year in which data were collected
Four-letter code of site at which data were collected

textDomain.definition: See "ASDN_Bird_captures.csv" data table Site attribute

attribute.attributeDefinition: Number of observers contributing to the list
Did all field crew members contribute?
Total person-hours in which observations were made that day to contribute to the list

The number of individuals seen is recorded for each species, except when individuals were not counted but the species was present (typically for very abundant species), an "X" is shown. The remaining columns list the full-name of species (birds and mammals) recorded for at least study site in at least one year.

dataTable.entityDescription: Raw data on invertebrate taxa identified in prey samples by Robert Wisseman, Aquatic Biology Associates, Inc., Corvallis, OR.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Four-letter code of site at which data were collected.

textDomain.definition: See attribute "Site_name" for "ASDN_Geodata.csv" Data Table for site code definitions

attribute.attributeDefinition: Year in which data were collected

textDomain.definition: Type of habitat in which the sample was collected
Type of habitat in which the sample was collected

Type of trap used to collect the sample. Dry and wet tundra were sampled by window pane trap collections into propylene glycol (malaise or cup trap). Aquatic samples were collected by either floating bottle trap or sweep net along water surface of windward shore.
Five replicate samples were collected in each habitat type at approx. 3-4 day intervals
Invertebrate taxon identified in the sample

attribute.attributeDefinition: Age class of the invertebrate taxon in the sample

textDomain.definition: Classification of species as non-insect or insect
Whether species is aquatic or terrestrial
Higher taxonomic classification of species
Taxonomic order (x = no Order classification)
Taxonomic family (x = no Family classification)
Species common name

dataTable.entityDescription: This file provides data on the lemming/vole trapping lines conducted at Nome in 2011-2013.

textDomain.definition: Four-letter code of site at which data were collected
ID of two transects, each containing 10 live traps
Number ID assigned to a specific station
Individual trap ID (10 traps per transect)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date when the prebait started. To familiarize lemmings with traps, each trap was prebaited with peanut butter and oatmeal for three days.
Date when the live-trapping was initiated
Time when the live-trapping was initiated

textDomain.definition: observer for checking trap

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date when the given trap was checked for any animal caught
Time when the given trap was checked for any animal caught
Number of individuals in the trap
Time that the vole or lemming received an ear-tag
Four-letter code of the species trapped

textDomain.definition: Unique number engraved on the eartag
Initials of observer who took the photo of lemming/vole followed by the unique photo number
Further information

dataTable.entityDescription: Weather data collected hourly by a HOBO U30 data logger at the field camp. Other camps used permanent weather stations (e.g. in nearby towns, airports); those data are archived and made publicly available by NOAA (US), Environment Canada, or Reliable Prognosis (rp5.ru).

textDomain.definition: Four-letter code of site at which data were collected (see ASDN_Geodata for site code and definition)
